in patagonia , you have the largest herbvore and the largest predator , living at roughly the same period and in the same terriory .
there is no asy answer .
evolution followed a number of partiular paths .
but a simpler interpretation rest on a warm climate and the fertile land , with all the vegetation you can eat .
yet another theory tell us that large herbivores had to grow big enough , to accommodate a large stomach required to digest high in fibre , low in protein vegetation .
finally , large spans of flat space could have led naturally to argentinosaurus , as the vast seas have led to whales .
